aboutSection.subtitle: Salut Orphelins et Malades Infectés
aboutSection.title: We believe in fostering resilience, promoting inclusion, and empowering communities
aboutSection.content1: Established in December 2018 in Les Cayes, Haiti. As a non-profit organization, our primary goal is to provide vital assistance to orphaned children and individuals living with HIV/AIDS in Haiti. Despite the numerous challenges faced, including pervasive discrimination, SOMI remains steadfast in its commitment to offering holistic support. We prioritize psychological and economic aid for persons living with HIV/AIDS, ensuring access to treatment and promoting adherence. Additionally, we provide educational assistance and medical care to orphaned children, aiming to support their development and growth.
aboutSection.content2: Through our initiatives, we strive to combat stigma, promote social inclusion, and empower communities to build resilient futures. SOMI Haiti is dedicated to making a lasting impact on the lives of those we serve, promoting dignity, hope, and well-being.

goalSection.subtitle: Building a Better Future Together
goalSection.title: Creating positive change in our community
goalSection.description: Our organisation is dedicated to making a lasting impact on life by resources and support to those in need. Through our programs and, we strive to empower individuals and create positive change.

content1.title: Health Care
content1.description: We are dedicated to ensuring access to healthcare services for all. Our goal is to provide comprehensive healthcare and support services to individuals living with HIV/AIDS. We strive to improve health outcomes and promote well-being for all.

content2.title: Education
content2.description: We believe that education is the key to unlocking potential. Through scholarships, tutoring, and educational support programs, we aim to empower these children with the knowledge and skills they need to build a brighter future for themselves and their communities.

content3.title: Community Development
content3.description: Strong, resilient communities are the foundation of sustainable development. Our goal is to foster community development through economic empowerment, social inclusion, and infrastructure improvement projects.

detailSection.subtitle: Promoting Community Development
detailSection.title: Making a difference in communities around the country
detailSection.description: Through our dedicated effort and community-driven initiatives, we made significant progress in area such as education, healthcare and environmental sustainability.

content1.title: Improving Education and Healthcare Access for All
content1.description: We believe in providing quality education, healthcare and community development programs to empower individuals and create positive change. We aim to empower individuals to reach their full potential.

content2.title: Supporting Sustainable Development Goals
content2.description: By supporting our organization, you are not only making a difference in the lives of individuals and communities in Haiti but also contributing to the broader global agenda for a more prosperous world.

content3.title: Building Strong and Resilient Communities
content3.description: We create environments where individuals can thrive and overcome challenges together. Join us in our efforts to empower communities, promote resilience, and create a brighter future for all.

content1.description: SOMI Haiti provided me with the healthcare services I desperately needed. I'm forever grateful for their support in my journey towards better health.

questions.question: What is SOMI Haiti?
questions.answer: SOMI Haiti, which stands for 'Salut Orphelins et Malades Infectés,' is a non-profit organization founded in December 2018 by Mrs. Rose-Gilène Clotaire in Les Cayes, Haiti. Our mission is to provide support and assistance to orphaned children and individuals living with HIV/AIDS.

questions.question: Is there a difference between HIV and AIDS?
questions.answer: Yes. - Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) is an infection that attacks the body's immune system, particularly white blood cells. However, HIV typically takes several years before it destroys immune defenses. AIDS is only mentioned when a person develops an opportunistic disease. When a person has AIDS, they are already necessarily infected with HIV. But not all people infected with HIV necessarily develop AIDS.

questions.question: What key advice for a child born with HIV (vertical transmission)?
questions.answer: Life remains and remains a precious gift. Do not underestimate yourself. Do not let yourself be intimidated, no form of discrimination should affect you. Work hard for your goals! Go after your dreams!

questions.question: Can I donate to SOMI Haiti?
questions.answer: Yes, you can donate to SOMI Haiti to support our programs and initiatives. Your donations help us provide vital assistance to orphaned children and individuals living with HIV/AIDS in Haiti. Visit our 'Donate' page to learn more about how you can contribute.

questions.question: Can an HIV-infected mother give birth to a healthy baby?
questions.answer: Yes, it's possible. This mother must have an undetectable viral load result. Then, from the early months of her pregnancy, she must go to the hospital to be taken care of, during the period and up to delivery.

questions.question: Can a person living with HIV afford to have an uninfected partner?
questions.answer: Yes. In the case where the infected person has an undetectable viral load, this means that they cannot transmit the virus. Otherwise, the uninfected partner can choose PrEP or both (2) decide together to use condoms.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: This page outlines our practices regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data and explains how we safeguard your information.

content.content: We do not collect any personal information from visitors to our website. Personal information refers to data that can be used to identify an individual, such as name, email address, or phone number. You can browse our site anonymously without the need to disclose any personal data.

We do not use cookies or other tracking technologies on our website. Cookies are small files stored on your device that are used to track your browsing behavior. While we do not use cookies ourselves, please note that third-party services integrated into our site, such as embedded videos or social media widgets, may use cookies or similar technologies. We do not have control over these third-party services and encourage you to review their privacy policies.

Our website may contain links to third-party websites for your convenience. These third-party sites have their own privacy policies, which may differ from ours. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of these websites. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of any third-party sites you visit.

Our website is not directed to children under the age of 13, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you are under 13 years of age, please do not provide any personal information on our website. If you believe that we may have inadvertently collected personal information from a child under 13, please contact us immediately, and we will take appropriate steps to delete such information.

While we do not collect personal data, we take appropriate security measures to protect any non-personal information collected through our website from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. We regularly review our security procedures to ensure they are up-to-date and effective.

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. Any changes will be posted on this page, and the effective date will be indicated at the top of the page. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Your continued use of the site after the posting of changes constitutes your acceptance of such changes.

If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy policy or the practices of our website, please contact us at [contact email or address]. We are committed to addressing any inquiries or complaints promptly and transparently.
